summary: This bill, the Ensuring Justice for Victims of Partial-Birth Abortion Act, mandates the Attorney General to investigate alleged violations of the Partial-Birth Abortion Ban Act of 2003, specifically concerning the remains of five babies discovered in Washington, D.C. It requires mandatory reporting of violations by healthcare practitioners and annual reports to Congress on enforcement efforts. The bill also mandates a Governmental Accountability Office (GAO) review of enforcement actions from 2004-2024. Finally, it includes a severability clause.
